conversations.content: Three hundred years ago, in a settlement ravaged by an imperial invasion...
Heh heh heh. You gave us some trouble there, friend, but you're cornered now.
To think a human would dare...
Bwaa ha ha ha! And to think that YOU, a mighty dragon, would fall like this! It's time for us to free the world from the clutches of you arrogant wyrms!
Wait, is that lightning? What the... GYAAAAAAAAH!
Who are the arrogant ones here, hmm? ...Are you all right, my brother?
You're the Lightwyrm!
Heard of me, have you? How delightful!
But yes, the proud ruler of thunderclouds has been pandering to the humans and aiding them in a fierce battle—or so say the latest rumors, at least.
I'm actually not ACTIVELY pandering. I just happen to find them intriguing and wanted a front-row seat to their goings-on.
While I thank you for saving me, Lightwyrm, I cannot consent to your ways. You must stop aiding the humans at once.
Do you not see this land? Their folly has turned the waters stagnant, befouled the soil, and polluted the winds. Such actions cannot be suffered to stand!
I hate the humans, and can never forgive the horrors they have wrought. As a fellow dragon, surely you must understand this!
Oh, I absolutely see why you'd think that if you only consider the Empire types. But...
The present day, in a city of commerce built up by the countless folk coming and going in its streets.
Goodness, but three centuries of time certainly do change a place. To think this used to be that broken-down little hamlet!
Oh no! This is terrible!
The city's being attacked by a dragon!
My hatred for humans burns my very soul, and I will hold back no longer!
Hey, bucko! Why the hell are ya attackin' the city?! What'd it ever do to you?!
Please calm down and tell us what happened. Maybe we can help.
I have waited three hundred years for your kind to reflect upon their misdeeds and show nature its due respect.
But you have NOT changed! Your ugly conflicts continue apace, and it is we dragons who suffer for them!
Now hold on just a hot minute there! It's the Empire who's causing you all that trouble, and the Empire alone.
The political bundling of your kinds is no concern of mine. My fury comes for all!
I don't want to fight, but...
You waited the full three hundred years? Now THAT'S discipline!
Do you know this dragon, Jupiter?!
I helped him out three centuries ago when he was being attacked by the Empire.
He was yelling about the same kinds of things all the way back then, so I stepped in to help smooth things over.
I hate the humans, and can never forgive the horrors they have wrought. As a fellow dragon, surely you must understand this!
Oh, I absolutely see why you'd think that if you only consider the Empire types. But...
While they might be foolish now, I think it's a tad premature to start employing the forceful hand now.
Explain yourself.
Compared to we dragons, people are little more than babies. And just as you wouldn't expect perfection from an infant, so too should we expect them to still be growing.
Be they adult or babe, I will not turn a blind eye to those who do harm.
A fair point. So how about this? In exchange for my having saved you, please give them a little more time.
Let's see... A hundred years is too short, and I'll get bored of waiting if we go to five, so what say we split the difference at three hundred years?
After all, three centuries is but an eyeblink to us dragons, right?
And what happens if I wait?
We'll have new generations of people, the trends of the times will shift, and the state of things will change for the better! ...Or that's my hope, at least.
An ambiguous argument.
That's because I don't know the future, which is what makes it so interesting. Certainly more interesting than killing all of them here and now, no?
Very well. I will give them three centuries. But if they fail to grow and learn, do not expect me to show any mercy.
Then I'll see you in a while!
...I did as you bade, Lightwyrm, and waited three hundred years to see if people could reform themselves. They did not.
They have not changed in these years. They destroy nature, make us suffer, and fight with unspeakable violence!
Wait, but—
No excuses! I will not hear it!
I don't think we're talkin' our way outta this one.
Hmm... I see. There's certainly some truth to what you say.
Jupiter...?
I'm sorry, Euden, but I'm taking his side on this.
From now on, I am your enemy!
WHAT?!
C'mon, you gotta be kiddin' me! He's for real attacking us!
Jupiter, stop! Why are you doing this?!
Do you remember what you said when we first met? Before we made our pact?
How can that have anything to do with attacking us in the here and now?!
Ha! I guess you'll just have to noodle over that one yourself.
This guy ain't messin' around, boss.
If we let things get too spicy, it's gonna blow back on the town and the people. I'm thinkin' we oughta back off.
Good call, Ranzal. Let's withdraw for now and regroup.
Jupiter!
I thank you for your aid, Lightwyrm. But you are comfortable with your choice?
Are you feeling pangs of guilt over my having attacked them?
If you care not, then I will let it go.
Well, just so you aren't laboring under any misunderstandings, it wasn't my express intent to be on the side of people.
I may have taken on human form, but I never meant to ingratiate myself to them. It was really more of a lark.
This baffles me.
Oh? From my point of view, it's a simple and clear course of action.
Help! Heeelp! The imperial army is invading the town!
The Empire is here to invade, you say? They must have thought to seize the chance when they saw the prince and his allies withdraw.
This is a strong point geographically, so I imagine they want to secure it for the strategic value.
In other words, new humans have come here to raise further havoc. Idiocy!
You there! Human! I have a question.
You're that violent dragon from before! Eeek! Stay away!
Answer this question, and be concise: Where are the people that seek to invade this place?
Huh? Well, um, I think they set up camp to the east of town.
I'm...not dead?
East of Town Imperial Army Encampment
Now that the meddlesome prince and his band have retreated, this is a prime opportunity for us to take control of the city! All troops, forwaaard!
Aaaaargh!
A dragon?! How is there a dragon here?! The prince was said to have withdrawn!
What are we going to do, sir?!
Keep your wits about you; one dragon is no match for us. Now surround it and attack!
Damn it, what's with the dawdling?! I told you to attack, so ATTACK ALREADY!
So you're going to remain safe in the back while everyone else does the dirty work? I'm almost impressed.
...But I'm also bored.
Aaargh!
Th-they got the captain! We're done for! Retreat! Retreeeat!
They have all taken heel.
Unexpected. Not going after them?
While I loathe humans, I do not believe they should be exterminated wholesale.
What we SHOULD do is—
Um, excuse me?
Hmm? Ah. A little human from the town.
Yeah! I saw you flying to those imperial soldiers, and I worried over what you going to do...
But you protected our town! You look scary, but you're actually a really nice dragon.
Yes, well...right. Return to your town and tell your people to leave this land if they do not wish to be thrust into unnecessary conflicts in the future.
Okay, I'll tell 'em all when I get home. Byeeee! And thank yoooou!
One minute you're attacking the town, and the next you're driving off occupiers. What's your actual goal here, friend?
Too many people had gathered in that town, and thus I attacked it.
Well, it's a hub for trade and traffic in the region, which is why the Empire wants it.
Wait. Are you saying you attacked the town so the residents wouldn't get wrapped up in any further conflicts?
Just so. If I destroy the city, the humans will no longer require the area and the need for the conflict will be eliminated.
Humans gather and expand without a care, which invites unnecessary conflict. Our battle from earlier serves as proof of this.
We can no longer prevent conflict merely by laying low those with villainous intent.
To eradicate human conflict, we must cut off their interactions and manage them with a much firmer hand.
Is that the answer you've come up with over the past three hundred years?
To keep the world righted, we must cull and manage the humans so evil does not spawn among them.
That is clearly the best method to eliminate misery in the world, and we should act upon it.
We, you say?
Yes, that's right. Join me, Lightwyrm! Join me as we guide the humans along the proper path!
Ah, yes. I think I understand now. And as such...
Yes, that's right. Join me, Lightwyrm! Join me as we guide the humans along the proper path!
Ah, yes. I think I understand now. And as such...
I have to turn down your invitation.
Why? Do you believe my methods ineffective?
It's not a question of effectiveness. It's a question of fun.
I was interested in the thinking behind your seemingly inconsistent actions...
But finding out you want to control the population in order to prevent fighting is a mighty disappointment.
You're rejecting change, which isn't going to lead to any kind of progress. In fact, it's just plain boring.
You would deny my invitation based on so vulgar a metric? I cannot understand you.
I hate the humans who pollute this world, and intend to prune them so they do not overgrow. This thinking is flawless!
Three hundred years, and you haven't changed a wit. Booooo-ring!
If you insist on being such a contrarian, I have no choice but to consider it a hostile act. Now prepare yourself!
Jupiter, are you okay?!
Perfect timing, Euden.
You're the ones the Lightwyrm drove away, yet now you seek to protect him? Why?!
Because I believe in our bond and have faith in him.
You what?
Jupiter is a fine dragon, and he would never betray us without a reason.
So after we retreated, I thought hard about his true motive in turning against us.
And you have discerned it?
Yes—but only because he gave me a hint.
Jupiter, stop! Why are you doing this?!
Do you remember what you said when we first met? Before we made our pact?
How can that have anything to do with attacking us in the here and now?!
Ha! I guess you'll just have to noodle over that one yourself.
I told Jupiter that guiding stray dragons back into the fold was my royal duty.
Once I remembered that, I came back to the two of you.
You grasped what I was thinking from that little exchange? Oh, but you ARE a fascinating creature!
Then this bond you spoke of is a mutual understanding between a dragon and human?
I know people seem foolish when held against the might and wisdom of dragons.
But there must be another option besides judging us all as a single whole and then attempting to manage our lives.
So you say.
So I know. There ARE other possibilities, and I can prove it if you permit me to guide you.
You? Guiding ME? To what end?
So I can show you a way in which humans and dragons might walk together.
All you need to do is come live with us at the Halidom for a little while.
And you claim this ＂Halidom＂ will prove to me that humans and dragons can coexist? Ha! What utter rot!
Are you so afraid of learning that the path you walk might be misguided?
I fear nothing-especially not the mumbled words of an utter trifle like yourself.
Then come with us to the the Halidom and see what I mean for yourself.
If you don't agree with what I'm saying after that, you can return to your old ways.
...Very well. I will entertain this drivel for a moment more.
Ooo, delightful! How will THIS play out?!
So this is the Halidom.
Yes. Here, many dragons and people live alongside one another in harmony.
If you examine our lives here, I'm certain you'll see a new path for our kinds.
MY DAAAAAAAARLING!
Ack! Mym!
Welcome home, darling! Are you tired? Perhaps I could make you some food, or draw a bath, ooooor...something else?
Flamewyrm! What in the name of all dragonkind are you doing in that form?!
Who's this sad sack?
Well, you see...
...So you want to show him the sweet bond of passionate love that we share? Ooo, that is a WONDERFUL idea!
Buh?! Er, no, that's not exactly what I—
Awww, you're EMBARRASSED! Just one of the many wonderful things about you.
M-Mym, wait!
...THIS is the possibility you were so eager to show me?
Er, well, it's one of them. But we have LOTS of other dragons here as well.
Let me give you the ol' ten-rupee tour.
Fydon! Felyx! It's time to eat!
Squeak! Squeak!
Enough, you two. Slow down and chew your food before you swallow.
Squeak!
Heavens, but they are adorable!
They're, like, eating out of your HAND! Ohmigosh, I can't even— I'm gonna barf, that's so cute! Time for some pics!
Gya! So bright!
Dude, shoot some grub down this way, yeah? I wanna get a selfie of me feeding your dragon buds!
This is most unfair! If you permit Nadine of all people this boon, then you must allow it of me as well!
Calm down, both of you! My dragons are on a very strict diet and can't just gorge at your whims!
Squeak! Squeak!
Aaaaand...PERFECT!
You gave 110 percent to that smithing, but you gotta be a total forge rat if you want to be the BEST OF THE BEST!
Daily discipline and steady practice will be the coal that feeds the fire of your skill!
You got it, Coach!
Ha! I couldn't help but overhear—and if it's training you require, leave it to me!
I'll use my knight's-armsmaster training to raise the standard of your blacksmithing by making your muscles ROCK HARD!
Our...muscles?
That's right. Muscles are the foundation of everything. Now, all of you line up! You too, bear! Get in there!
Bear... Wait, do you mean ol' Coach?!
Look sharp, you four, because you're in MY world now! So let's get started with your extra-special training!
Yes, ma'am!
Well? What are your impressions of the people and dragons you've seen so far?
Perhaps there is something to the prince's assertion that humans and dragons might live in peace and harmony.
I wonder if my hate for human actions caused my own viewpoint to narrow.
I once believed humans required dragons' intervention to live prosperous lives...
But perhaps I was mistaken.
...Do you seriously mean that?
What do you mean?
I told you before, there's some truth in what you'd been saying about humans.
What are you suggesting, Lightwyrm?
GUYS! BAD! REALLY BAD! SO BAD! SO, SO, SO, SOOOOOO BAD!
Those Empire goons are back, and they're headed straight for a nearby village!
We have to help them. To arms, everyone!
Well, well. It seems we have a chance to see one of your ＂ugly conflicts＂ for ourselves. Shall we?
What...
This will finish it! Haaaah!
Gyaaa!
Go, my darling!
I call upon the power of the pact! ...Now, everyone! With me!
What am I seeing?
Why, this is the futile, ugly conflict you so abhor. Can't you tell?
We can't take any more of this... Retreat! All units, retreeeat!
The Empire is fleeing! We've won the day!
Goodness! It's over already? That was even faster than I anticipated.
Is it a common occurrence for the Empire to attack and you to drive them off?
It certainly is. Even we dragons need to protect ourselves from danger, no?
Even if one side doesn't want to fight, once the battle has started, they often can't extricate themselves from it—and Euden is no exception.
So humans cannot stop their conflicts? But then what of the sights I saw back at the Halidom?
I am confused. Can people truly coexist alongside us, or must they be managed?
Don't know the answer, eh? Yet earlier you said you felt like you understood.
Then tell me the answer, Lightwyrm! What is the correct path? What must I do?
Oh, I think you'll just have to noodle over that one yourself.
Hey, I'm not going to rush this part! Not when you're finally starting to change and become a little bit interesting.
I cannot fathom your meaning.
Heh heh! Well, you just get to noodling, and I'll be all ears when you eventually find the answer. Byeeee!
Well then? Do you still loathe humans?
My hatred toward your kind burns ever bright. And yet...
And yet I must admit I felt a pang of skepticism about this view when I saw what life was like in the Halidom.
Sounds like your opinion has changed.
Changed? No. It's true that your words and deeds began to sway me for a moment, but then I bore witness to the ugly fight just now and was conflicted anew.
Which is the real you: the kind souls at the Halidom or the bloodthirsty warriors on the battlefield? My hate lacks direction! I must know!
The Lightwyrm refused to help and instead abandoned me to this question, so I now find myself confused once more.
Sounds like something he'd do. I wouldn't worry about it too much.
The Lightwyrm does what the Lightwyrm wants, and what he wants is amusement. I promise he's out there somewhere chuckling at how he made you squirm.
Hmm...
You probably didn't have any doubts when you were attacking the town, but then you talked to Jupiter and they started to spring up. Is that right?
The reason he was antagonistic toward all of us earlier was so he could get a chance to speak properly with you.
I admit I would not have listened to human words in that moment save for his actions.
I think Jupiter really wanted you to adopt a new perspective—and he wanted you to change.
Yes, I see now. I was measuring the worth of your kind by my values as a dragon, for it is all I have had to go by during these past three hundred years.
While I swore people had not changed in that time, it was actually I who had been rendered immobile and static.
So what will you do now?
I do not know. But I will eventually find the answer to my question—and when I do, rest assured I will return to you and convey it openly.
We'll be waiting.
Heh heh. I can't wait to see what answer you come up with, my friend.
Though as to whether it will make us friends or enemies...who can say? Heh heh heh!
